c2a1: A64 devices will load the bootloader from an SD card first if one is available so those are effectively unbrickable
RK3399 devices are a bit more tricky, they'll load from eMMC first, so a physical switch is included that disconnects the eMMC if needed
Although before even that they'll load from SPI so if you want some reassurance you can also flash the SPI chip on devices that have it like the PBP

Hello, I plan to use pine64 hardware to validate a new block-chain in a sustainable way with low power devices such as RP64 and coming soon Quartz64. I read  brand and logo guidelines https://wiki.pine64.org/wiki/PINE64_brand_and_logo and I was wondering whom to ask. Thanks for your answer.
assuming it's non-commercial, i think that it's allowable as "software [that] is compatible with PINE64 hardware"

As far as trademarks in the US, you can use the term "Pine64" as long as there is no "likelihood of confusion". E.g. you can say "Tested to work with Pine64" but not use Pine64 in the name of the project (generally speaking). The logo might be usable under fair use but it depends on the circumstances.
For example, it's probably fair use to include the logo in a "compatible with" section, but not on a coffee mug as another example.
You can contact info@pine64.org if you want to get permission first
>>> Commercial use of the logo, logotype or brand name, as well as any derivatives or alterade logotypes, is not permitted without prior consent of Pine Store Ltd. This means that any software project, merchandise vendor or community endeavour that seeks to turn a financial profit based on the PINE64 brand name needs to first acquire appropriate consent from Pine Store Ltd.
This is an interesting thing from their terms. As far as I know, US law doesn't allow companies to require pre-approval for trademark use. But it could be different depending on where you live.
